attributes.action: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda
attributes.background: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda, publicly supporting ISIS or  getting people to join ISIS.

attributes.action: To create a maximum working environment temperature.
attributes.background: Working in conditions that are too hot can become counter productive and can mean that staff cannot fully function and work to their best capacity.

attributes.action: Stop the force of adoption from innocent young mums!
attributes.background: I fell in love at a young age like most of us do, it was a confusing time but I though that was it life was perfect, so when I fell pregnant and then found out it was twins! I had my family for life but then because of my age social workers started sniffing around.
attributes.additional_details: I had a good childhood, just my mum and siblings but we had it good  (not having a father around made my decision to keep my babies easier!) I had never even heard of social services until I got pregnant. I got allocated a family nurse  (who befriended me,secretly was against my pregnancy) from there the child snatching plan begun, me and my partner went into a unit together to bring up our children independently , they let me dote over them for a year while secretly finding them a new mum.

attributes.action: Stop charging extortionate Child Visa fees and NHS Surcharges
attributes.background: Dependent children of Non-EU immigrants are charged same visa fees and NHS levy as adults. It is appalling that child visa fee in a temporary visa category is as much as £1790+ £200 NHS levy/year. They are not entitled to any kind of state benefits in the UK and shouldn’t be charged hefty visa fees
attributes.additional_details: If a Non-EU family of 4, 2 adults and 2 toddlers, needs to extend their stay in UK for 2 years, they would pay £7160 Visa + Biometric fees and £1600 NHS levy. Visa fee is irrespective of how short is their stay, means if an immigrant’s spouse and a child granted 6 months visa they would still pay £3580 in visa fees only. Fair fees are part of business ethics and Governments are also expected to conduct their business ethically. Be ethical and considerate and abolish child visa fees and NHS Levy

attributes.action: hold a referendum on  giving 0.7% of GDP in foreign aid.
attributes.background: Call on the British government to hold a referendum on giving 0.7% of GDP to foreign aid

attributes.action: Bring back Capital Punishment for Convicted Terrorists and Killers.
attributes.background:
It is time to send a strong message to those that would halm innocent unsuspecting ordinary law abiding people.
And to ensure that when terrorists or Killers are convicted and found guilty that they are perminatly removed from our society!

attributes.action: Raise motorway speed limit to 80mph with a minimum of 55mph.
attributes.background: We advocate raising the speed limit on motorways and dual carriage-ways from 70mph to 80mph and setting a minimum speed of 55mph to reduce impeding the flow of traffic and cause of sudden braking.
attributes.additional_details: Motorway speed limits were originally designed in the days when vehicles could not break in time. We advocate raising the motorway limit to 80mph. Drivers travelling under 50mph impede the flow of traffic, cause a nuisance to other drivers and can cause vehicles to have to brake hard increasing the chance of an accident.

attributes.action: Provide a Suit/Professional clothing Allowance for all Citizens.
attributes.background: Recently David Cameron said to Jeremy Corbyn "Put on a proper suit, & do up your tie” when discussing NHS funding. As Mr Cameron feels that a high quality, professional clothing matters as much as healthcare, it's reasonable for UK citizens to ask for an allowance to cover the cost of such garments.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of Mr Camerons opinion on the importance of high quality professional clothing, as well as more information & a full case can be found at the following petition on change.org, as 800 characters is not enough to flesh out the full issue. Both this petition, and the petition at change.org should be signed by all interested individuals & parties:

https://www.change.org/p/the-uk-conservative-government-make-the-tory-government-provide-a-suit-professional-clothing-allowance-for-all-citizens

attributes.action: Abolish the CCG system established in 2013
attributes.background: In 2013 the Government abolished PCT's in order to create "local" Clinical Commisioning Groups (CCG's).  This system is floored in so many ways. Patients are at risk under this system, Expertise have been scattered leaving huge gaps in our services, CCG's hide behind badly managed CSU's.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that an urgent review is undertaken by the Health Secretary. The CCG's must be regulated by the CQC if they are to continue. I have multiple case studies of Patients care being put in severe danger due to the poor conduct our CCG's insist on operating. They REFUSE to communicate directly with services they commission, refuse to pay their bills and refuse to provide life dependant equipment because of cost. URGENT action is required before someone dies!! Our NHS is at risk!!

attributes.action: Allow MPs the right to vote on any future changes to UK immigration law
attributes.background: Theresa May changed UK Immigration Law in July 2012. UK Citizens must meet minimum income requirements to return home with a Non-UK or Non-EU spouse. MP's never voted on this change, because The 1971 Immigration Act gave any Home Secretary the power to impose changes, without Parliamentary consent.
attributes.additional_details: Ours and thousands of British families are affected by this July 2012 change in Immigration Law. Our British son married an american lady 3 1/2 years before the Law changed. They now have two sons. The present law will not allow him to return home to the UK with his family because he cannot fulfil the minimum income requirements. Our son has paid taxes in UK and gave 5 years of his life to the Territorial Army. We can afford to take in refugees and people from EU, so let our own people home too.

attributes.action: Time-cap production hours.
attributes.background: Local trading estates are exploiting British Citizens to harmful levels of pollution. Production occurs on a 24hour basis and this is massively contributing to the pollution levels coming from the UK.I propose that the government begin to time-cap production hours to a sensible 12 hour working day.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, London has already breached the annual levels of pollution within the first week of 2016. This is a huge cause for concern as this is impacting the lives of our future generations. Not only, it is impacting current day and our health. This becomes a burden on public health services as 29,000 deaths a year are pollution based, and also life expectancy is shortened by six months on average.We need to start acting now, and not encourage these industrial areas to harm our lives any more.

attributes.action: Instigate effective state services to swiftly help UK homeless off the streets.
attributes.background: It's unacceptable for our government to do so little to help the single adult homeless. I'd like the state to run a year-round service similar to Crisis at Christmas: a safe bed, food, washing facilities, help for alcohol/drug problems, counselling, and advice to find a more long-term home and work.
attributes.additional_details: On Christmas Day we stopped at a petrol station on our way back from visiting family. Two very cold young adults were huddling under a threadbare blanket. The man had been homeless for 8 months, the woman for 7 years. She was ghost-like: pale, ill and defeated. I returned to give them money, gloves, hats and scarfs. We call ourselves a civilised society and yet we leave it to charities to help single adult homeless people. Our government needs to take responsibility and do something directly.

attributes.action: Re-Nationalise all public transport.
attributes.background:
The public transport in this country is a horrid affair. 
Overpriced, overcrowded, dirty, old and not efficient enough. 
In many area's of the UK people cannot afford a car, and rely on public transport daily.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a 22 year old British citizen from Northampton. I am currently running my own business, its in its third year and doing quite well.
My business is a video production company, as you can imagine, without a car I am forced to use public transport, and have many a time been let down, the public transport companies have lost me clients and money many a time due to the atrocious service.
Many a time I do not even get a seat on a train, even though Ive paid £50 to travel a few miles

attributes.action: Restore the small profits rate of Corporation Tax at 15% for profits to £300,000
attributes.background:
Since the 2011-12 tax year, the small profits rate of Corporation Tax has been eroded to zero.

In these uncertain economic times, we ask the government to support small businesses by restoring the small profits rate of Corporation Tax at 15% and locking this rate at 5% lower than the main rate.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2011-12 tax year, the main rate of Corporation Tax was 26% against the small profits rate of 20% for businesses with profits of up to £300,000.

Since then, the main rate has been steadily reduced with no comparable reduction in the small profits rate.  

As a result, since April 2015, there has been a harmonized Corporation Tax rate of 20%.

attributes.action: Dissolve Parliament after leadership elections to trigger a General Election
attributes.background: I believe that no public mandate exists for the incumbent government and the period of government following the EU referendum is too important to proceed without such a mandate.

attributes.action: Stay in the EU, enact Proportional Representation, and call a General Election
attributes.background:
Following the referendum on the UK’s membership of the EU, we the undersigned call upon the British government to:

1. Reject the outcome of the referendum and formally state that the UK wishes to remain in the EU.

2. Enact Proportional Representation.

3. Call a General Election.

attributes.action: Disability football should get more recognition
attributes.background: I Strongly Believe That Disability Football Should be Recognized more as a normal thing in society and that our government should support it more by supplying more funding and more publicity,
attributes.additional_details: Football can play a key role in any persons development let alone a disabled persons development, It can help them get Independence, socialize more and develop fine motor skills. Most football clubs run Disability football and it should get recognize more just like main stream football.

attributes.action: Allow a second referendum on the subject of our membership of the European Union
attributes.background: We believe that the "In" or "Out" choice was too simplistic for a decision of such importance and that clear and unbiased information was not available. We believe that we should have been asked additionally, or instead, "Would you chose to remain within a substantially reformed European Union"?

attributes.action: Honour our Queen by minting coins in real silver
attributes.background: Being a metal detectorist my friends and I find so many beautiful ancient coins that have stood up to being buried for centuries.  The coins we have now would have all rotted away of a similar period, let's honour our Queen by minting a few nice silver coins.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at the Spinks coin book and you can see many examples of the beautiful coins our Monarchy once had minted in their name. For me to give examples I would need to be able to upload examples of Silver Hammered coins or the Silver Milled ones of more recent times.

attributes.action: Establish London as an independent state so it can remain in the EU
attributes.background: Greater London voted overwhelmingly to remain. A disproportionate amount of our taxes goes to finance other regions in the UK & our economic wellbeing is severely threatened by a decision imposed upon us by others. We wish to cede from the UK & become an independent state within the EU.

attributes.action: Give all British expats and EU citizens living long-term in UK vote on EU.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Act of 2015 disqualified many people who vote in local or general elections from voting on EU membership. We ask for a reform of the Act, to give franchise on EU membership to all British expats, and to EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years.
attributes.additional_details:
Commonwealth citizens residing in the UK could vote on EU membership on 23rd June 2016, whilst expats living abroad for more than fifteen years, and EU citizens living in Britain, could not. This disfavours individuals who have fully invested in the opportunities granted by Britain’s long-term membership of the EU. We believe the Act goes against EU rights of free movement and the constitutional, common law of Britain.
We ask for another Act to be passed to allow a new Referendum in which all expats, and EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years, may vote. If we are to leave or remain in the EU, it must be a lawful decision, reflecting the wishes of our entire society.

attributes.action: Create a memorial or name a room within the Palace of Westminster after Jo Cox
attributes.background: Jo Cox MP was a Member of Parliament who dedicated the past year to her community and often fought for more things for Young people. In the memory of her life I propose that the Palace of Westminster name an area, room or dedicate a memorial to her life in her memory.

attributes.action: Make the UK main summer test cricket series, a free to air television event.
attributes.background: This petition is for a ruling, that the main test cricket series of the summer in England or Wales be shown on free to air television. As are The FA Cup, The Six Nations and The Grand National; with a protected, permanent free to air broadcasting status.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition strongly believes that in order to develop the next generation of cricket stars, youngsters need to be able to easily and readily see cricketing heroes, performing at the highest cricket level. It is one of our national sports and the entire nation should be able to watch the main summer test match series.

This is one test series a year on free to air television. So this petition feels that this is a fair demand.

attributes.action: Scrap the tv licence fee of £145.50 and change it for an NHS fee for £145.50 phh
attributes.background: We're always saying we have not got enough money for the NHS well let the bbc pay for itself by advertising and change the fee for a NHS fee set in the same format as the TV licence by each household paying either yearly quarterly monthly or weekly. I know what I would rather pay for

attributes.action: The PM to report monthly on progress and initiatives to tackle tax avoidance
attributes.background: We increasingly hear about tax avoidance by the rich and by large companies. We also hear politicians say that they are keen to see this issue tackled but warm words aren't enough, let's see a monthly report, including quantifiable measures, so we can see and track progress in a systematic way
attributes.additional_details: Tax avoidance in the UK reputedly costs the UK £16 billion a year. It is not fair and it should be tackled rigorously by the Government and the Prime Minister should be held to account personally

attributes.action: More beds available in the Burnley/ Blackburn mental health inpatient units
attributes.background: Too many people lose their lives due to the lack of resources within the mental health sector. One of the biggest problems arising at the moment is the lack of beds available in the Lancashire inpatient mental health units. These beds could save the lives of those who need immediate help.

attributes.action: Ban Angela Merkel from entering the UK.
attributes.background: More innocent people have been killed by terrorists, this time in Brussels. There have been more attacks since Angela Merkel opened her arms to immigrants, some of which have been proven to have been terrorists. The vetting process has been inadequate. This will only get worse without action!

attributes.action: Use the Sugar Tax income to fund a Healthy Foods Voucher scheme for all.
attributes.background: Poor nutrition in our country often comes down to affordability. A Healthy Foods Voucher Scheme, funded by the Sugar Tax income, would make healthy foods more affordable. These vouchers could include Vegetables, Fruit, Eggs, Meat and Fish for all households and be exchangeable by any grocery outlet.

attributes.action: Work with other countries to try and free Ahmed Mansour Karni.
attributes.background: Ahmed Mansour Karni is a 4 year old boy in Egypt who has been convicted of 4 murders and attempting to kill 8 others at the age of 1. He has been sentenced to life by the Cairo Court however he is completely innocent. How can a 1 year old child commit murders and threaten law enforcement?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/ahmed-mansour-karmi-four-year-old-sentenced-to-life-in-prison-for-murder-in-egypt-after-court-a6883936.html

PLEASE READ AND HELP! PLEASE TAKE 2 MINUTES OF YOUR TIME TO SIGN!

attributes.action: Abolish private schools.
attributes.background:
As education is such an important determinant of future life expectations  it is completely unfair that it is segregated according to the wealth of an individual's family.
We should strive for equality of opportunity, education is a right and it should not be dependent on someone's background.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory standards for how MPs communicate with their constituents.
attributes.background: Once an MP is elected, they can ignore their Constituents’ wishes.  Constituents must wait five years before they can do anything about this.  MPs can even ignore Disabled Constituents, or refuse to have email addresses etc. for people to contact them.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs should be required to:-
1)  make contacting them accessible for everyone; and
2)  adhere to basic equality standards.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd as home secretary
attributes.background: We the 17 million who voted to leave,have no confidence in amber rudd as home secretary..Her performance during the debates was appalling and very childish..We expect a brexit home secretary asap.Who will deliver what we have asked for and will be fit for the job.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa may must accept and do the will of the undersigned ..We should of had a vote for who runs our government.

attributes.action: Government to condemn the USA police forces for killing innocent Black citizens
attributes.background: Statistics show that on average around 30 African American citizens in America are killed by law enforcement officers each month.  This is unacceptable in a civilized society.  The UK is America's closest alley and so should be able to speak up and ask that America takes measures to stop this issue.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_in_the_United_States

attributes.action: To guarantee the rights of EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, the futures of EU nationals living in the UK and UK nationals living in EU countries are completely unknown. We demand that they are allowed to remain in the country of their choice.
attributes.additional_details: This petition does not seek to overturn the recent referendum result or request a second referendum.  It simply seeks to ensure that any Brexit deal guarantees the residency and employment rights of EU nationals living in Britain and Britons living in other EU countries which are not currently guaranteed. This has left many individuals and their families uncertain of their futures.

attributes.action: Make welfare forms easier to understand for people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: As a young adult with a learning disability and autism. i have found that most forms that are used by local councils and the DWP are in a format that many people with a learning disability will struggle to understand and process them leading applicants to get anxious and reluctant to apply.
attributes.additional_details: When corresponding the information. the letters and forms don't always specify what you need to send off, and the way the questions are phrased or relayed a person with a disabilitiy wont understand what is in front of them or will struggle look at all information, so the councils and dwp need to make all official documents learning disability friendly

attributes.action: Government to HONOUR Britain's Worst Maritime Disaster the RMS Lancastria
attributes.background: The Lancastria sank 17th June 1940 taking with it between 5-10,000 men women and children plus pets making it Britain's Worst maritime Disaster. France have recognised the sinking, Scotland has recognised the sinking with a medal plus monument on the Clyde 2011. What have the British done-NOTHING!
attributes.additional_details: After many years writing to the British Government regarding recognition for "Britains Worst maritime Disaster!" The government choosing every year to ignore pleas and cries of not only the survivors of the disaster but also the families of those lost. Last year stand in for our Prime Minister Osborne finally acknowledged that the disaster ever took place and stated it was now "appropriate" to recognise the sinking which has brought strange feelings of mistrust and anger amongst its Nation.

attributes.action: Make spitting of Paan in public places a Civil offence.
attributes.background: Paan is a preparation combining betel leaf with areca nut and sometimes also with tobacco.It is chewed for its stimulant and psychoactive effects.
attributes.additional_details: Paan made with areca nut and lime, with or without tobacco, causes profuse red coloured salivation.This saliva is spat, yielding stains and biological waste pollution in public spaces. Many countries and municipalities have laws to prevent paan spit.Health effects of chewing paan: gum damage, tooth decay and oral cancer.

attributes.action: Fully regulate Student Loans Company, with reform of the repayment process.
attributes.background: Many graduates have been left thousands of pounds short by an administrative process that is not fit for purpose. This petition calls on the Government to reform the repayment process and regulate Student Loans Company in line with retail lenders.
attributes.additional_details:
Graduates leave education with thousands of pounds worth of debt that is repaid via their payslips. The money is collected by HMRC and passed to Student Loans Company annually to be credited to the outstanding balance.

Current arrangements mean that money is frequently not credited to the loan, despite being paid by the graduate. This means it can take longer to repay a student loan, while interest is accrued.

HMRC and SLC do not to have mechanisms to check/rectify mistakes in a timely manner.

attributes.action: Call a General Election in 2017.  Brexit needs a plan with an electoral mandate.
attributes.background:
A referendum vote to leave and "take our freedom back" is not a plan - its a protest. We need a plan on how we leave and what we do next.
This plan should have an electoral mandate from us all - Brexiteers and Remainers alike. 
That is the only way to can build a new unity and a strong future.
attributes.additional_details:
We need three things ASAP:
1. The parties (old guard, and maybe new?) should propose their Brexit plan. 
2. A General Election should be called soon - ideally Spring 2017.
3. The plan people want most will receive a proper mandate.
We can make something good happen. We will have to look beyond our party allegiances to do so. Please get stuck in. Share, like, petition, .... or come up with something better than this.

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government

attributes.action: Create an offence of making knowingly or recklessly false claims in elections
attributes.background: The EU Referendum on the continuing membership of the EU has highlighted the use of clear untruths and other misleading comments.  Voters have suggested they would have voted differently if they had known the truth.  There should be criminal liability for such activity to prevent it reoccurring.
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign claimed that £350M per week would be released to be spent on the NHS.  This claim was stated to be false by "Leave" within days of the vote.

Individuals who make false statements to the state (for example in relation to benefits) risk being prosecuted, whilst politicians are not censured for false statements to the people.  We believe that a separate offence of knowingly or recklessly making false statements or misleading the public in relation to elections is required.

attributes.action: Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service check
attributes.background:
It is not compulsory for Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check. Previously known as a CRB check.

From the age of 16 you are eligible for Compulsive Basic Training (on a scooter) which means you can have 1:1 tuition from an approved Motorcycle Instructor.
attributes.additional_details:
A teaching profession which involves contact with young people should have DBS check as a mandatory requirement to safeguard the general public.  NHS workers, teachers and approved driving instructors (ADI) all have a DBS check.

The Driving Standards and Vehicles Agency uses the loose term of 'Fit and Proper' to approve a Motorcycle Instructor. Those individuals who have a previous criminal record, or spent time in prison, can still become or continue their role as Motorcycle Instructor.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Migration Impact Fund
attributes.background: The first Cameron ministry scraped the Migration Impact Fund in 2010. The £50million fund was set up by the Brown ministry to help local government deal with the effects of pressure of high levels of immigration. By reintroducing this fund we can ensure that migration benefits everyone in society.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2010/aug/06/fund-impact-immigration-scrapped

attributes.action: Social Services should have to voice record all meetings and visits.
attributes.background: Social services often try to put those who attend meetings with them off when it come to recording meetings. Their code of conduct explains they should be open and honest so I question why they will not do this. It would help to avoid disputes over what was said and ensure clarity for documentation
attributes.additional_details:
Social services documents are well known for being inaccurate and falsified. If you notify social services you wish to record all meetings they take extreme exception however if they were to note down events accurately surely this would just be another form of evidence.
Social services having to record means they cannot deny knowledge of events, or be accused of recording inaccurately as there will be evidence of what was said. It also can act as a form of reference to ensure reports reflect events.

attributes.action: Control immigration to prevent overpopulation and economic depression
attributes.background: Immigration is becoming a big issue in Europe and even bigger in the UK. With current immigration levels the UK is on the path to extreme overpopulation which could mean even more strain on services such as the NHS, Housing, public transportation and almost all other public services will be affected
attributes.additional_details:
The guardian on overpopulation in Britain: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/feb/09/is-britain-full-home-truths-about-population-panic
Top 10 overpopulated countries (including UK(3rd party)):
http://www.newstatesman.com/blogs/the-staggers/2010/07/population-index-overpopulated
Overpopulation is clearly a highly likely event in the UK unless the government is blind to see the high population increase in the UK then they should be doing more to delay it or prevent it.

attributes.action: Make gastro pacemakers available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
People suffering from Gastroperesis are being denied a simple operation to have a pacemaker fitted in their stomachs to help with gastro emptying & therefore stop the constant nausea & vomiting. 
Thank you for your help.
attributes.additional_details: Gastroperesis is an illness where the stomach can't empty due to nerve damage. We all take it for granted that when we eat the food passes through the stomach to the intestinal tract but with Gastroperesis the food just sits fermenting in the stomach& causes extreme nausea & vomiting.

attributes.action: 2 years Jnr armed forces training should count towards your pensionable service.
attributes.background:
I want the uk government to recognize armed forces training as a junior from 16 to 18 should count towards your pensionable service.
Any other industry would recognize your employment at 16 from day one.
This affects your pension as a working serviceman or woman in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I joined the Army as a 16 year old soldier & spent 2 years training.
Then completed 9 years colour service, then 1 year open engagement.
The government only recognise 9 years colour service as this technically the contract i signed. 
In business where service is recognised, where else would you have 3 years not rewarded in any way, especially as those are the years I spent learning my trade.
My pension has been devalued by 3 years because the government will only pay for my contracted period of 9.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising of formula (all stages)
attributes.background:
By banning all advertising of infant formula in the UK, it will hopefully ensure that more mothers breastfeed their children. Which in the long run will save the NHS money too! 
New mothers are bombarded with advertising of formula with damaging statements such as 'the closest ever to breastmilk'.
attributes.additional_details: Banning advertising of infant formula has massively helped improve breastfeeding rates in other countries, hopefully it could help us in Britain too... we currently have some of the worst breastfeeding rates in the WORLD!!

attributes.action: Make 23 April "NHS appreciation day"
attributes.background: 1 and 17 March, and 30 November are bank holidays in Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland. There is no such holiday on 23 April in England. This date should be nominated as appreciation day of a Great British and Northern Irish institution to unite all who benefit from this service around the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS makes me proud to be a citizen of the UK. As I sit here and write this from my baby son's bedside on a children's ward, I am moved to tears by the care he is receiving tonight from highly trained and caring professionals who have left their own family behind to care for mine. What is most amazing is that this is free at the point of use for all. Why not dedicate a day per year for the appreciation of the NHS and its staff.

attributes.action: Ban the transportation and slaughter of pregnant sows
attributes.background: Tired, terrified and heavily pregnant sows are being transported to abattoirs and  frequently give birth during this harrowing journey.
attributes.additional_details: For many piglets their initial experience of this world consists of lying helplessly on the floor of a vehicle which is carting their mother off to slaughter or falling through slats onto the road below.
